timeline.bodyText: I think this is cut and paste error.
timeline.author: dannysmyda

timeline.bodyText: Is this check necessary? I think you can just let the for loop recognize there is nothing to process.
timeline.author: dannysmyda

replies.bodyText: It was removed and ran fine
replies.author: markmckinnon

timeline.bodyText: I think you can remove this comment, assuming you did change it
timeline.author: dannysmyda

timeline.bodyText: The first condition should check not empty.
timeline.author: dannysmyda

timeline.bodyText: You also need to catch UncheckedIOException, a runtime wrapper for IOException. The IOException caught here, according to the Files.walk documentation, is just related to accessing the iLeappOutputDir. If there is a problem while iterating, then UncheckedIOException will be thrown. Checked exception support was never worked into Java 8 streams and lambdas. You can log the underlying IOException by calling ex.getCause() or something like that.
timeline.author: dannysmyda
dannysmyda
dannysmyda

timeline.bodyText: See previous comments on Files.walk() in the ingest module, UncheckedIOException should be caught here too.
timeline.author: dannysmyda
